meanings.definition: The quality or state of being saprogenic
meanings.sent1: The saprogenicities of the compost pile were evident in the foul smell emanating from it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the saprogenicities of different organic materials to understand decomposition better.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient for his 'rotten stew' was the saprogenicities of the expired meat.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was a testament to the saprogenicities of neglect, with mold creeping up the walls.
meanings.sent5: The forest floor teemed with saprogenicities, as fallen leaves turned into rich soil.

meanings.definition: The process of decay or putrefaction
meanings.sent1: After weeks of rain, the saprogenicities of the fallen tree trunk were clear as it crumbled into the ground.
meanings.sent2: The smell of saprogenicities filled the air as the fish left out in the sun started to rot.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie set was so realistic that even the fake bodies seemed to exude saprogenicities.
meanings.sent4: In the abandoned laboratory, jars of forgotten experiments displayed the saprogenicities of time.
meanings.sent5: The old book showed signs of saprogenicities, with its pages yellowed and crumbling.

meanings.definition: The ability to cause decay or putrefaction
meanings.sent1: The potent saprogenicities of the toxic waste led to the contamination of the river.
meanings.sent2: The fungus's saprogenicities were so strong that it could decompose even the toughest materials.
meanings.sent3: The villain's evil plan involved a serum with the power to enhance the saprogenicities of any organic matter.
meanings.sent4: The ancient curse was said to possess the saprogenicities to turn living beings into statues.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house seemed to have a life of its own, with the saprogenicities of decay spreading through its walls.
